TESTING STRATEGY

QuizMentor Testing Strategy

Overview

Comprehensive testing strategy covering unit tests, integration tests, E2E tests, and performance testing for the QuizMentor manipulation stack and remote configuration system.

Testing Architecture

Test Coverage Requirements

Minimum Coverage Targets

  • Overall: 80%
  • Manipulation Logic: 95% (critical path)
  • Remote Config: 90%
  • UI Components: 70%
  • Utilities: 85%

1. Unit Tests

Store Tests (tests/unit/stores/)

StreakStore Tests

describe('StreakStore', () => {
  // Core functionality
  âœ“ should increment streak on consecutive days
  âœ“ should reset streak after 24 hours gap
  âœ“ should not increment if already updated today
  âœ“ should update longest streak when exceeded
  
  // Streak danger detection
  âœ“ should detect danger zone (18-24 hours)
  âœ“ should trigger notifications at critical times
  
  // Freeze mechanics
  âœ“ should use freeze to preserve streak
  âœ“ should not use freeze if none available
  âœ“ should not use freeze if not in danger
  
  // Milestones
  âœ“ should award milestone rewards at 7, 30, 100, 365 days
  âœ“ should trigger celebration animations
  
  // Edge cases
  âœ“ should handle timezone changes
  âœ“ should handle daylight saving time
  âœ“ should persist state to AsyncStorage
});

HeartsStore Tests

describe('HeartsStore', () => {
  // Core mechanics
  âœ“ should start with 5 hearts
  âœ“ should lose heart on wrong answer
  âœ“ should block quiz when depleted
  
  // Regeneration
  âœ“ should regenerate 1 heart per 30 minutes
  âœ“ should cap at maximum hearts
  âœ“ should calculate time until next heart
  
  // Premium features
  âœ“ should give unlimited hearts to premium users
  âœ“ should not regenerate for premium users
  
  // Ad rewards
  âœ“ should grant hearts after watching ad
  âœ“ should apply diminishing returns
});

LeaderboardStore Tests

describe('LeaderboardStore', () => {
  // Fake user generation
  âœ“ should generate 200+ realistic fake users
  âœ“ should position user in middle ranks (100-150)
  âœ“ should show nearby competitors
  
  // Live updates
  âœ“ should update fake user scores periodically
  âœ“ should show rank changes
  âœ“ should trigger notifications when passed
  
  // Manipulation
  âœ“ should keep user in frustrating middle
  âœ“ should show achievable targets ahead
  âœ“ should apply premium badges to fake users
});

Service Tests (tests/unit/services/)

RemoteConfigService Tests

describe('RemoteConfigService', () => {
  // Initialization
  âœ“ should load cached config first
  âœ“ should fetch remote config
  âœ“ should fall back to cache on error
  
  // Feature flags
  âœ“ should return correct flag values
  âœ“ should apply rollout percentages
  âœ“ should handle nested values
  
  // A/B testing
  âœ“ should assign variants consistently
  âœ“ should respect target audience
  âœ“ should track experiment exposure
  
  // Dynamic pricing
  âœ“ should apply engagement-based pricing
  âœ“ should apply location-based pricing
  âœ“ should apply frustration discounts
  
  // Content management
  âœ“ should fetch dynamic quiz questions
  âœ“ should submit user questions
  âœ“ should handle errors gracefully
});

NotificationService Tests

describe('NotificationService', () => {
  // Scheduling
  âœ“ should schedule daily notifications
  âœ“ should send at optimal times
  âœ“ should respect user timezone
  
  // Streak reminders
  âœ“ should send danger zone alerts
  âœ“ should escalate urgency
  
  // Social pressure
  âœ“ should send fake friend activity
  âœ“ should create FOMO
  
  // Win-back campaigns
  âœ“ should escalate re-engagement
  âœ“ should offer increasing discounts
});

2. Integration Tests

API Integration Tests

describe('API Integration', () => {
  // Supabase operations
  âœ“ should authenticate users
  âœ“ should sync user progress
  âœ“ should fetch remote config
  âœ“ should handle real-time updates
  
  // Error handling
  âœ“ should retry on network failure
  âœ“ should queue offline mutations
  âœ“ should sync when reconnected
});

Service Communication Tests

describe('Service Communication', () => {
  // Store-Service integration
  âœ“ should update analytics on store changes
  âœ“ should trigger notifications from stores
  âœ“ should sync with remote config
  
  // Cross-service communication
  âœ“ should coordinate between services
  âœ“ should handle circular dependencies
  âœ“ should maintain data consistency
});

3. E2E Tests

Complete User Journey Tests

describe('Manipulation User Journey', () => {
  // Onboarding to conversion
  âœ“ Day 1: Easy success for dopamine hit
  âœ“ Day 2-6: Build streak habit
  âœ“ Day 7: Milestone celebration
  âœ“ Day 8: Introduce frustration
  âœ“ Day 9: Apply social pressure
  âœ“ Day 10: Convert to premium
  
  // Streak manipulation
  âœ“ should show danger notifications
  âœ“ should reset and offer freeze
  âœ“ should celebrate milestones
  
  // Hearts frustration
  âœ“ should deplete on wrong answers
  âœ“ should show regeneration timer
  âœ“ should push ads then premium
  
  // Daily challenges
  âœ“ should show countdown urgency
  âœ“ should lock premium challenges
  âœ“ should animate last minute
  
  // Leaderboard manipulation
  âœ“ should show fake users progressing
  âœ“ should position strategically
  âœ“ should create competition anxiety
  
  // Notification manipulation
  âœ“ should send at optimal times
  âœ“ should fake social activity
  âœ“ should escalate urgency
  
  // Dynamic pricing
  âœ“ should trigger frustration discounts
  âœ“ should adjust by location
  âœ“ should personalize offers
});

Remote Configuration E2E Tests

describe('Remote Configuration E2E', () => {
  // Feature flags
  âœ“ should toggle features without update
  âœ“ should apply gradual rollouts
  âœ“ should target user segments
  
  // A/B testing
  âœ“ should assign variants consistently
  âœ“ should track metrics correctly
  âœ“ should conclude experiments
  
  // Dynamic content
  âœ“ should load new questions
  âœ“ should update categories
  âœ“ should schedule events
});

4. Performance Tests

Load Testing

describe('Performance Under Load', () => {
  // Concurrent users
  âœ“ should handle 10,000 concurrent users
  âœ“ should maintain <100ms response time
  âœ“ should scale horizontally
  
  // Data operations
  âœ“ should efficiently query large datasets
  âœ“ should cache frequently accessed data
  âœ“ should optimize database queries
});

UI Performance Tests

describe('UI Performance', () => {
  // Animation performance
  âœ“ should maintain 60 FPS during animations
  âœ“ should not block main thread
  âœ“ should lazy load heavy components
  
  // Memory management
  âœ“ should not leak memory
  âœ“ should clean up listeners
  âœ“ should optimize image loading
});

5. Manipulation Effectiveness Tests

Dark Pattern Validation

describe('Dark Pattern Effectiveness', () => {
  // Loss aversion
  âœ“ should create streak anxiety
  âœ“ should trigger FOMO responses
  
  // Social pressure
  âœ“ should induce competition anxiety
  âœ“ should create peer pressure
  
  // Artificial scarcity
  âœ“ should create urgency with hearts
  âœ“ should limit time for challenges
  
  // Variable rewards
  âœ“ should create dopamine responses
  âœ“ should maintain engagement
});

Conversion Funnel Tests

describe('Conversion Funnel', () => {
  // Metrics tracking
  âœ“ should track funnel steps
  âœ“ should identify drop-off points
  âœ“ should measure conversion rates
  
  // Optimization
  âœ“ should A/B test variations
  âœ“ should personalize experience
  âœ“ should maximize LTV
});

Test Execution

Running Tests

# Unit tests
npm run test:unit

# Integration tests
npm run test:integration

# E2E tests
npm run test:e2e

# Performance tests
npm run test:performance

# All tests with coverage
npm run test:coverage

# Watch mode for development
npm run test:watch

CI/CD Pipeline

name: Test Pipeline

on: [push, pull_request]

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
      
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm install
      
      - name: Run unit tests
        run: npm run test:unit
      
      - name: Run integration tests
        run: npm run test:integration
      
      - name: Run E2E tests
        run: npm run test:e2e
      
      - name: Check coverage
        run: npm run test:coverage
      
      - name: Upload coverage
        uses: codecov/codecov-action@v2

Mocking Strategy

Mock Data Generators

// Generate realistic fake users
export const generateFakeUser = (overrides = {}) => ({
  id: faker.datatype.uuid(),
  name: faker.name.fullName(),
  xp: faker.datatype.number({ min: 1000, max: 5000 }),
  streak: faker.datatype.number({ min: 0, max: 365 }),
  isPremium: faker.datatype.boolean(),
  ...overrides
});

// Generate test scenarios
export const generateTestScenario = (type: 'frustration' | 'engagement' | 'conversion') => {
  // Return appropriate test data
};

Service Mocks

// Mock notification service
export const mockNotificationService = {
  scheduleNotification: jest.fn(),
  cancelNotification: jest.fn(),
  getScheduledNotifications: jest.fn(() => [])
};

// Mock analytics service
export const mockAnalyticsService = {
  track: jest.fn(),
  identify: jest.fn(),
  getMetrics: jest.fn(() => ({
    frustrationScore: 0.5,
    conversionLikelihood: 0.3
  }))
};

Test Data Management

Fixtures

// User states
export const userStates = {
  newUser: { /* ... */ },
  engagedUser: { /* ... */ },
  frustratedUser: { /* ... */ },
  premiumUser: { /* ... */ }
};

// Quiz data
export const quizFixtures = {
  easyQuestions: [ /* ... */ ],
  hardQuestions: [ /* ... */ ],
  premiumQuestions: [ /* ... */ ]
};

Database Seeds

-- Test users
INSERT INTO users (id, email, created_at) VALUES
  ('test-user-1', 'new@test.com', NOW() - INTERVAL '1 day'),
  ('test-user-2', 'engaged@test.com', NOW() - INTERVAL '30 days'),
  ('test-user-3', 'premium@test.com', NOW() - INTERVAL '90 days');

-- Test progress
INSERT INTO user_progress (user_id, streak, hearts, xp) VALUES
  ('test-user-1', 1, 5, 100),
  ('test-user-2', 30, 3, 5000),
  ('test-user-3', 100, 999, 50000);

Monitoring & Metrics

Test Metrics to Track

  1. Test Coverage: Overall and per module
  2. Test Execution Time: Identify slow tests
  3. Flaky Test Rate: Tests that fail intermittently
  4. Test Failure Rate: By category and severity
  5. Performance Regression: Response time changes

Test Quality Indicators

  • Deterministic: Tests should not be flaky
  • Independent: Tests should not depend on each other
  • Fast: Unit tests < 10ms, Integration < 100ms, E2E < 10s
  • Readable: Clear test names and assertions
  • Maintainable: DRY principle, shared utilities

Best Practices

  1. Test Naming Convention 
    describe('[Component/Service]', () => {
  it('should [expected behavior] when [condition]', () => {
    // Test implementation
  });
});
  2. AAA Pattern 
    it('should calculate correct price', () => {
  // Arrange
  const user = { frustrationLevel: 0.8 };
     
  // Act
  const price = calculateDynamicPrice(user);
     
  // Assert
  expect(price).toBeLessThan(BASE_PRICE);
});
  3. Test Isolation
    • Reset state before each test
    • Mock external dependencies
    • Use test databases
    • Clean up after tests
  4. Snapshot Testing
    • Use for UI components
    • Review snapshot changes carefully
    • Keep snapshots small and focused
  5. Continuous Testing
    • Run tests on every commit
    • Block merge on test failure
    • Monitor test metrics
    • Regular test review and refactoring

Troubleshooting

Common Issues

  1. Flaky Tests
    • Check for timing dependencies
    • Ensure proper async handling
    • Mock Date.now() and timers
    • Use explicit waits over arbitrary delays
  2. Slow Tests
    • Profile test execution
    • Mock heavy operations
    • Use test data builders
    • Parallelize where possible
  3. False Positives
    • Verify assertions are specific
    • Check mock implementations
    • Ensure proper test data
  4. Maintenance Burden
    • Extract common test utilities
    • Use page object pattern for E2E
    • Regular test refactoring
    • Remove redundant tests

This comprehensive testing strategy ensures the QuizMentor manipulation stack and remote configuration system are robust, reliable, and effective at achieving their dark pattern objectives while maintaining system stability.
